intro: Anemone intermedia, commonly known as the common anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with a basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive central yellow stamen, blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Anemone intermedia is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
